channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Harris to Certify Trump’s Victory, and Driving in Manhattan Gets Pricier
item.description: Plus, you probably haven’t seen the Golden Globe winners.

item.title: Allstate CEO Tom Wilson strikes the wrong tone
item.description: Also: Carvana stock slides on short report, Former TGI Fridays CEO returns, AI social media backfires for Meta.

item.title: In Seoul, Blinken Affirms Alliance Amid Challenges to Democracies
item.description: The U.S. secretary of state aimed to show that his country stood by South Korea as it grapples with a political crisis, and as Donald J. Trump returns...

item.title: In Haiti, Gang Massacres and Journalist Murders Expose the Country’s Fragility
item.description: In Haiti, gangs have killed hundreds of people and shot journalists at a news conference, exposing the country’s fragility and the government’s failur...

item.title: EV sales reached UK record in 2024, but came at a ‘huge cost’ and are ‘unsustainable’ industry warns
item.description: Automakers were forced to dish out EV incentives to hit UK government-mandated sales targets, a situation that will get "even more intense" in 2025.

item.title: Pope Names Robert McElroy, an Ally on Immigration, as Cardinal in Washington
item.description: The appointment of Robert W. McElroy is a signal of the pope’s priorities, two weeks before Donald J. Trump’s term begins.

item.title: Monday Briefing
item.description: The Jan. 6 riot, four years on.

item.title: West Bank Settlers Hope Trump Will Back Annexation Dreams
item.description: Settler leaders say they are confident that a Palestinian state is off the table, but their expectations are tempered by their experience of Donald Tr...

item.title: In Seoul, Blinken Affirms Alliance Amid Challenges to Democracies
item.description: The U.S. secretary of state aimed to show that his country stood by South Korea as it grapples with a political crisis, and as Donald J. Trump returns...

item.title: Pope Names Robert McElroy, an Ally on Immigration, as Cardinal in Washington
item.description: The appointment of Robert W. McElroy is a signal of the pope’s priorities, two weeks before Donald J. Trump’s term begins.

item.title: Kamala Harris will preside over the certification of her own loss when Congress certify’s Donald Trump’s Electoral College victory on Jan. 6
item.description: Trump is returning to office after winning the 2024 election that began with Biden as his party's nominee and ended with Vice President Kamala Harris ...

item.title: Renewables set to dominate as UK and Germany hit a clean energy high in 2024
item.description: Renewable energy like wind and solar accounted for 59% of production in Germany last year, while in Britain it stood at 45%.

item.title: Congestion Pricing’s True Test Comes During First Rush Hour
item.description: The tolls were introduced just past midnight on Sunday. Officials are still assessing how they are affecting traffic patterns in New York City.

item.title: How Scammers Could Cheat NYC’s Congestion Pricing Tolls
item.description: Drivers who obscure their plates or otherwise circumvent paying tolls already cost the city’s mass transit system millions of dollars.

item.title: Schools and government offices in several states across the U.S. closed due to winter blast of snow and ice
item.description: The National Weather Service issued winter storm warnings from Kansas and Missouri all the way to New Jersey.
